defs: (log.) the connection or concomitancy of an effect with a cause or of a positive inference from positive premises.

the condition or quality of being unripe.
the condition, quality or period, of lacking emotional maturity or sense of responsibility; immaturity.
a particular variety in dancing.
wanting something to be whole; incomplete; imperfect; deficient; falling short of.
the state or quality of being incomplete, imperfect, deficient; incompleteness; imperfection.
not broken; free from dents and defects.
without limits or restrictions; lacking or seeming to lack boundaries; unlimited; illimitable; enormous; infinite.
the state or quality of being free from limits or restrictions; lack of boundaries; enormous size or extent; enormity; illimitability.
that cannot be measured or calculated; being beyond imagination; immeasurable; incalculable.
(math.) designating a real number not expressible as an integer or as a quotient of two integers; irrational; infinite.
the Supreme, who is beyond human imagination, reasoning or capacity to comprehend; the Infinite.
the quality of being immeasurable.
the quality of (a number, of) being irrational; irrationality of a number.
a number that can be expressed as an infinite decimal with no set of consecutive digits repeating itself indefinitely and that cannot be expressed as quotient of two integers; an irrational number.
the fact or condition of being unchangeable; unchangeableness.

not changing or not having the tendency to change oneself; that cannot be converted; that cannot be changed or exchanged; never changing or varying; not liable to be changed; unchangeable; immutable; inconvertible.
the quality of being not changing; absence of tendency to change oneself; immutability; unchangeableness.
that which is not changing or not liable to be changed.
(zool.) in some classifications, the lowest in sects, with little or no metamorphosis; ametabola.
not changed; unchanged.
that cannot be changed, modified or metamorphosed.

not clean; not pure; impure; unclean.
unclean according to religious ritual; defiled.
mixed with foreign or inferior quality matter; adulterated.
characterised by grammatical errors, unidiomatic usages, etc.
not made free from other matter or from impurities; not purified.
suffering from crudeness or coarseness; uncultivated; inelegant.
